meanings.definition: Shaking or quivering with fear or nervousness.
meanings.sent1: The small dog looked trembly during the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent2: Her voice sounded trembly as she spoke in front of the large audience.
meanings.sent3: The trembly kitten hid behind the couch when the vacuum cleaner turned on.
meanings.sent4: The old house's trembly floors creaked with every step.
meanings.sent5: The trembly leaves on the tree danced in the wind.

meanings.sent1: The trembly ground warned of the approaching earthquake.
meanings.sent2: The trembly bridge swayed in the strong wind.
meanings.sent3: The trembly ride on the rollercoaster made her scream with excitement.
meanings.sent4: His trembly hands struggled to hold the delicate glass figurine.
meanings.sent5: The trembly engine of the old car sputtered to life.
